column4: can someone please help me with the command to download and install gnome on my new 6.06 server pls?
installing the ubuntu-desktop metapackage should grab everything for you
out of interest, why didn't you just grab the desktop iso if you wanted gnome?
have a look at the /etc/apt/sources.list file
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list  ... sudo gives you admin write ability to the file, and nano is the name of the console editor you wish to view the file.
thanks.. i will try.. what should be in there as default?
are you on another computer currently?
looks like my sources.list file was completely commented out
did you uncomment the deb lines?
I did, and it still won't go and look for the packages
after you saved the changes to the file that is
I found half the problem.... network cable was plugged into the wrong NIC port
yes, that may have affected things...
after getting the right port, un-commenting the lines in sources.list and the aptitude update, it's now downloading ubuntu-desktop.  Thanks for your patience
sure, hope everything goes smoothly for you
Well.. so far so good.. next step is find a vmware package, if someone has made it
